reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Lindos Bay Hotel (Mareblue)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is good if somewhat samey each night. They only seem to label some of the food on offer which is very confusing when looking for non meat dishes. Staff can appear too keen to clear your plates between courses. Not sure if this is attention to service or to chivy you along! Only 2 very small lifts. They charge for the gym which is part of spa. Up to 10 euro for gym is out of order. Drinks at bars are expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are large and cleaned daily. Free safes and fridge in room. Air con worked fine. Hotel right on pebbly beach but has decent fresh water pool. The real downside is the lack on any real entertainment, especially for kids or teenagers. There is a very enthusiastic guy that organises a few daily pool games but at night you have poor singing synth combos types. Lindos is a 7-10 euro taxi away and that mounts up every night. Buses are not reliable as far as I can see and most only stop at top of very steep climb to road. Staff are generally friendly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very impressed with the hotel, we had a sea view room which was spotlessly clean and came with complimentary drinks and fruit. I also thought the dressing gowns in the hotel were a nice touch especially to wear if you fancied an early morning swim.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I personally found the location was a bit too far out of Lindos and the taxi's did add up albeit there was a bus service through the day but if you were content to spend your time at the hotel the facilities were fantastic, decent sized pool and a small indoor pool with decking area outside. The hotel is right on the beach which was kept immaculate.
reviews.title: Relax in an Idyllic location with good food and the best service.

reviews.text: On the food front I thought they had a decent choice but my partner did struggle as he is vegetarian and it was a bit uninspired on the vegetarian front, so we did swap the evening meal for a lunchtime meal a few times and ate out in Lindos.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel & excellent location and staff

reviews.text: The Spa was a pleasure to visit and all in all this was a very relaxing holiday.
reviews.title: A good holiday, with reservations

reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from the Lindos Bay Hotel after two weeks stay, and thought the hotel was fantastic and excellent value for money. The hotel was spotless and the staff all very friendly.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday
Our wedding holiday.
reviews.text: We spent a fabulous week at the Lindos Bay Hotel at the beginning of October. We were staying there to attend our daughter's wedding and have a nice break ourselves.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was obvious that it was the end of season, there were no queues for food etc. There were no young children and the whole place had an air of calm. We found the rooms and the service very good, the food excellent, being able to choose quantity and type easily. The staff were very pleasant, efficient and friendly too. Our experience was a complete pleasure.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel & Staff. Really Beautiful Location but not for eating out

reviews.text: We booked with Thomas Cook to visit this hotel in October 2009. We used TripAdvisor to find a hotel suitable for our needs and this hotel was the best that Thomas Cook did in the area (review-wise).
